alert.note: Alert for Washington (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 22 at 11:37PM EST until February 23 at 4:26PM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mettawee River At Granville. * WHEN...Until Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Minor flood stage. Widespread flooding of fields along the river. Water on Upper Turnpike Road and Gray Lane. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:15 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 6.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to a crest of 7.4 feet Wednesday morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 7.4 feet on 07/16/1996. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Mettawee River Granville Flood Stage: 7.0 Observed Stage at Tue 11 pm: 6.5 Forecast: Wed 1 am 6.9 Wed 7 am 7.4 Wed 1 pm 6.7 Wed 7 pm 6.5 Thu 1 am 6.2 Thu 7 am 6.0 Thu 1 pm 5.8 Thu 7 pm 5.6 Fri 1 am 5.5 Fri 7 am 5.4 Fri 1 pm 5.3 Fri 7 pm 5.2 &&
